title: How to combat writer's block? Did you ever acquire it while writing your novel - Quora

response.answer_text: The reason it gets so bad is because you think you need to fight it. I’ll explain. We all have 2 sides to our brains. One side is more analytical. The other is more artistic. I theorize that writer’s block happens when we shift too much focus onto the analytical side and here’s how to fix it. You need both to write obviously, but when the writing just flows, you’re using your artistic side of the brain. When you have writer’s block you just shifted over to the analytical. How does this shift happen? We start thinking about deadlines. We start questioning if it’s good enough. We start looking for typos. We start editing what we already wrote. This is all analytical. And the more it creeps in, the more we move away from our creativity. It all seems logical and important, but it becomes counter-productive when it blocks your flow. Try to shut this stuff off while you write and get back into that creative heart space. Some methods I’ve found that work are: Exercise — get the blood flowing, release endorphins and studies show you become more creativeMeditate — Don’t meditate on what you’re writing. Instead use this time to recenter yourself, relax and re-focus.Bounce ideas off friends — no man is an island. Sharing with others can get those creative juices flowing againSpend time with inspiring visuals. Seek out places or images that inspire you. Focus on the emotions they invoke. For some people, music works better.You might also find this article helpful. Defeat Content Writer's Block Once & For All

There are days when writing, for me, is easy, and days when it is not. However, I don’t know that I’ve ever experienced “writer’s block.” What I have experienced is that I’ve made a mistake and taken something I’m writing to a place where I can’t continue writing it, because I’ve boxed myself in or otherwise created an untenable position. The solution isn’t to break through the block, it’s to go back, figure out where I made the mistake, and fix it.
